item.title: Ants
item.description:
Dedicated ants on the march
Patience in their step through harsh
Weather, rain, hail, seasons pass
Smallest Species is dead last

In the dominance hierarchy
Their tunes programmed from suffering
unconscious monarchy
It’s survival, efficiently set
They made their bet
On the Queen, rarely seen

Lives in a Palace, an ant pile
While the army continues single file
A line, protective order, for the chaos
Be ready to react, back flip on the event

Of relative evil, be evil
Its chaos, a rouse to fight
left, right, left, right
Ants keep marching on, unbeknownst to them

A future may be
Weak individually
Stronger as a whole
Marching forward, these little ants are so bold

Holding a losing hand, yet still don’t fold
Hearts beating, life’s giving, all
These ants, we, are predators
To shield, defend, at any cost (any cost)

Strength is the source
With possibilities to grow & shrink
Age plays a role, how cold through you
Clues observable in nature, clear truth

Ants keep marching on
unconscious of the truth
Ants keep marching on (marching on)

Subroutines, subconscious bubbles, seeds blossom
Growing electrical trees, frequencies
of the brain, awareness unnecessary
as ants keep marching on, through all time

Through the years, the fear, and tears
How weird.
